Content:: The inner surface of the mastoid portion of the temporal bone presents a deep, curved groove, the sigmoid sulcus, which lodges part of the transverse sinus; in it may be seen the opening of the mastoid foramen. This article incorporates text in the public domain from page 142 of the 20th edition of Gray's Anatomy (1918)  This human musculoskeletal system article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
Title: Sigmoid sulcus - Wikipedia
